titleStmt.title: Thomas T. Binford to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG7313

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Hickman Ky
November 10th 1865
To his Excellency,
Gov Thos E Bramlette

The undersigned a citizen of Fulton County Kentucky states on oath that the Petitioner H F Cheatham was not interested with him in the Union Farmer's Hotel where it is alledged that he Kept a gaming House but that the undersigned was at the time sole proprietor of the said Hotel and alone responsible for what went on there. Owing to his absence his evidence could not be made available for Cheatham or he could have proved that the said Cheatham never kept a gaming House on his premises and was not responsible for any gaming carried on there as this affiant alone had control of them.
subscribed & Sworn to before me, 10th Novr 1865
Samuel Landrum Judge Fulton County Court
